page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS.POSTLING.
page.content: Services in this area are almost non existant with no public transport of any kind, no school, shop, garage or public house. The Mobile Library stops in the village once a week and refuse is collected bi-weekly. For all other services the village is reliant on helping its own community. The Church of St.Mary's is the focal point of the village and there is a newly built village hall which is used for a table tennis club and private functions only. The Womens Institute for the area is located at the nearby village of Stanford.
